channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Universities hold graduation ceremonies as students protest across the US
item.description: Some colleges have canceled or modified graduation ceremonies as more than 2,000 people have been arrested on campuses since April 18, as pro-Palestinian protests ripples across the US. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Mystik Dan wins 150th Kentucky Derby by a nose in a 3-horse photo finish
item.description: Mystik Dan won the Derby in a photo finish over Forever Young and Sierra Leone.

item.title: May 4, 2024 - Israel-Gaza news
item.description: Hostage and truce talks have resumed in Cairo as war rages in Gaza.

item.title: Warren Buffett says AI may be better for scammers than society. And he's seen how
item.description: The value of its investment portfolio plunged even as core businesses prospered

item.title: May 3, 2024 - US college protests
item.description: More than 2,100 people have been arrested on college and university campuses since April 18, as a wave of pro-Palestinian protests ripples across the US.

item.title: Army sergeant arrested in alleged murder-for-hire plot against 4 people: Police
item.description: Servicemember Jeremiah Peikert was arrested for allegedly conspiring with his brother, Joshua Peikert, to hire a hitman to kill four people, including two children.

item.title: Former Trump aide Hope Hicks testifies in hush money trial
item.description: Former President Donald Trump's hush money trial continues in New York.

item.title: Progress reported in Gaza truce talks, but Israel hasnâ€™t sent a delegation
item.description: A Hamas delegation is in Cairo, Egyptian state media cites "noticeable progress"

item.title: US job market shows signs of cooling, with just 175,000 jobs added in April
item.description: The latest snapshot on US employment was a shocker: The economy added 175,000 jobs, far below expectations for 235,000 and a reversal of the trend for robust monthly gains.

item.title: 178 people rescued amid Texas flood watch: 'We're not out of the woods yet'
item.description: A flood watch remains in effect for more than 11 million people in Texas and Oklahoma on Saturday morning as a number of flood warnings are in effect.
